directions: How about some sausage with that! Slice one pound of cooked sausage into discs and mix with the bean and vegetable stew before adding the breadcrumbs. From here, you can either heat them through for another 15 minutes on the stove, then finish with the breadcrumbs, or add an additional cup of water/broth, scatter that breadcrumbs on top and bake it in a 350°F oven for 20 minutes until the sausage is heated through.
ingredient_list: 3 medium leeks (white and pale green parts only)
3 (19-ounce) cans cannellini or Great Northern beans, rinsed and drained or 4 1/2 cups cooked dried beans (dried beans cooking instructions here)
1 19-ounce can diced tomatoes, with their juice
4 cups coarse fresh bread crumbs from a baguette
Halve leeks lengthwise and cut crosswise into 1/2-inch pieces, then wash well and pat dry.
Make garlic crumbs while cassoulet simmers:
Preheat oven to 350°F with rack in middle.
Discard herb sprigs and bay leaf. Mash some of beans in pot with a potato masher or back of a spoon to thicken broth. Season with salt and pepper. Just before serving, sprinkle with garlic crumbs.
title: vegetarian cassoulet
